title.narrative: OUTPUT 2: OUT OF SCHOOL CHILDREN & ALTE

description.narrative: Output 2: By 2018, boys and girls aged 6-18 years old have increased access to quality basic education, transition to secondary and alternative learning programmes focusing on the most vulnerable children, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Early Childhood Development, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Salaries and Related Costs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: By 2018, boys and girls aged 6-18 years old have increased access to quality basic education, transition to secondaryand alternative learning programmes focusing on the most vulnerable children

description.narrative: UNICEF has successfully enrolled 37,336 OOSC (43 percent girls; 2 percent children with disability) back to schools through enrolment drives and community mobilization in 9 Arid and Semi-Arid counties. 4,278 teachers (45 percent female) are using the Digital Attendance Application to monitor attendance of 207,310 children (47 percent girls). | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018
